intro: Ceratodactylis osmundioides, commonly known as the spiky liverwort, is a unique member of the plant kingdom characterized by its intricate, thalloid structure. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is distinguished by its dense, leaf-like structures that form a cushion-like growth. The plant exhibits a specialized morphology with prominent, spiny projections that provide structural support and aid in water retention. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an important subject for studies on bryophyte evolution and ecological adaptation.
